page.title: 13HOUSING
page.content: The houses in Melling and Maghull vary between old and new, large and small. We saw enormous mansions and tiny cottages but most of the population live on modern estates built in the last 30 years. The oldest home we saw was Barnes Farm which was built in l654. One of the most interesting houses which we saw was The Old House which once belonged to Hornby the inventor of Meccano. Hornby's house was not the only famous person's house we saw. We also saw Ian St.John's andIan Callaghan's (famous footballers). There is also a very pleasant home for the elderly, and both private and council owned sheltered housing. The whole area is pleasant to live in and most houses have access to a garden.
